subject: Design
title: Bioplastics: The Promise and the Problem
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Bioplastics: The Promise and the Problem.

hook.text: Bioplastics sound like the answer to plastic pollution. The reality is more complicated.

buildup.text: Made from corn starch, sugarcane, or algae, bioplastics replace oil-based polymers with plant-based ones.

discovery.text: PLA (polylactic acid) from corn looks and feels like plastic but is technically compostable.

twist.text: PLA only composts in industrial facilities at 140Â°F. In landfills or oceans, it behaves exactly like regular plastic.

climax.text: Bioplastics reveal that material design alone isn't enough â€” you must design the disposal system too.

punchline.text: Bioplastics are only green if the system behind them is too.

quiz.question: What is the main problem with PLA bioplastics?
options: They only compost in industrial facilities, not in nature
